    • getChessboardOfPossibleMovesFromSquareAt

      public boolean[][] getChessboardOfPossibleMovesFromSquareAt(int x, int y) throws EmptySquareException
      Calculating legal moves of Piece in given coordinates in Piece[][] chessBoard
      Parameters:
      x - x position of Piece
      y - y position of Piece
      Returns:
      boolean[][] array, where legal moves are true and illegal are false
      Throws:
      EmptySquareException - todo: checking player's turn checking if king isn't in danger

      Parameters:

      Returns:

      Parameters:
      chessboard - original chessboard isn't modified by this method

      fromY -
      toX -
      toY -
      Returns:

    • getPieceAtTheEndOfLine

      public Piece getPieceAtTheEndOfLine(int posX, int posY, int vecX, int vecY)
      Finds Piece on the end of straight or diagonal line
      Parameters:
      posX - excluded starting X position of line
      posY - excluded starting Y position of line
      vecX - direction, can be only 3 states: -1:left, 0:none, 1:right
      vecY - direction, can be only 3 states: -1:down, 0:none, 1:up
      Returns:

    • promotion

      public void promotion(int posX, Piece pawn, char chosenPiece)
      Modifies board to promote Pawn to chosen Piece
      Parameters:
      posX - X position of Pawn
      pawn - Pawn that should be promoted
      chosenPiece - letter of chosen Piece that Pawn should be promoted to, can be either: 'n' - Knight, 'b' - Bishop, 'r' - Rook or 'q' - Queen

    • checkIfKingIsSafe

      public Boolean checkIfKingIsSafe(char color)
      Checks if some enemy Piece on the board can beat King of given color method should be used on temporary Chessboard object, created by getChessboardWithExecutedMoveWithoutCheckingIfMoveIsLegal(...) method
      Parameters:
      color - of King that we want to know if is safe
      Returns:
      true if King is safe, false if King can be beaten
